data.comment: Message displayed to users when creating a new mailing list and no message templates that could be used for welcome or goodbye message are present.

data.value: Skip the first row (check when first row represents the headers)
data.comment: phrase: Skip the first row (check when first row represents the headers)

data.name: NoMailingListsFound
data.comment: Message shown to user when searching for a mailing list and no mailing lists are found.

data.name: UnsubscribedSuccessMessage
data.value: You have successfully unsubscribed from the mailing list. You will no longer receive the newsletters sent to this mailing list.
data.comment: Message displayed to the user when he or she unsubscribes from the mailing list.

data.name: YouDontBelongToTheMailingList
data.value: You don't belong to the mailing list and cannot unsubscribe.
data.comment: Message displayed to user who tries to unsubscribe from the campaign he or she does not belong to.

data.name: YouCannotUnsubscribe
data.comment: Message displayed to user who tries to unsubscribe and some error prevents the action.

data.name: LicenseWarning
data.value: You have {0} subscribers in your system, which is more than permitted by your license. Please either remove some of the subscribers or upgrade your edition of Sitefinity. Until resolved, you will not be able to send campaigns.
data.comment: The message displayed to users when they have more subscribers in the newsletters module than allowed.

data.name: HowToImproveDelivered
data.value: To improve this metric consider keeping your mailing list up to date.
data.comment: text: To improve this metric consider keeping your mailing list up to date.

data.name: HowToImproveUniqueOpenings
data.value: To improve this metric consider creating an A/B test that tests separately the timing of your campaign, its subject or sending email.
data.comment: text: To improve this metric consider creating an A/B test that tests separately the timing of your campaign, its subject or sending email.

data.name: HowToImproveUniqueClicks
data.value: To improve this metric consider creating an A/B test that tests the relevance of your information. Make sure there are enough actionable links for your audience.
data.comment: text: To improve this metric consider creating an A/B test that tests the relevance of your information. Make sure there are enough actionable links for your audience.

data.name: HowToImproveUnsubscribed
data.value: To minimize this metric consider segmenting your customers and sending more relevant information to your audience.
data.comment: text: To minimize this metric consider segmenting your customers and sending more relevant information to your audience.

data.name: HowToImproveOpenedInFirstHours
data.value: To improve this metric consider creating an A/B test that tests separately the timing of your campaign, its subject or sender email.
data.comment: text: To improve this metric consider creating an A/B test that tests separately the timing of your campaign, its subject or sender email.

data.name: AbTestExplanation
data.value:
Performing an A/B test will help you find out which of the versions of an email is more effective.

The main idea is that you prepare two versions of one email — version A is sent to a small portion of the subscribers in one mailing list and version B is sent to another small group of them.

After the email is sent the results of both emails are measured and based on them the winning email is chosen and sent to the rest of the subscribers.
data.comment: Explanation text for the A/B tests.

data.name: WhatsVariousBouncesHint
data.value:
The reasons for an email to bounce might be (but not limited to):
  • Full user mailbox
  • Too large message
  • Message is considered as a SPAM
  • Invalid email address
data.comment:
text: The reasons for an email to bounce might be (but not limited to):
  • Full user mailbox
  • Too large message
  • Message is considered as a SPAM
  • Invalid email address

data.name: WhatsAbTest
data.comment: phrase: What is an A/B test?

data.name: IssuesThatWillBeSentForABTest
data.value: Issues that will be sent for an A/B test
data.comment: phrase: Issues that will be sent for an A/B test

data.name: TestNameDescription
data.value: For your convenience only. Used to help you easily find and recognize a particular test
data.comment: phrase: For your convenience only. Used to help you easily find and recognize a particular test

data.name: TestingNoteDescription
data.value: Add a note what exactly you want to test and what you expect to learn from this test. This note will be added to this A/B test detailed info
data.comment: phrase: Add a note what exactly you want to test and what you expect to learn from this test. This note will be added to this A/B test detailed info

data.name: TestingSampleDescription
data.value: Use the slider to define what part of the users in {0} mailing list will participate in the A/B test. After the test is finished the winning issue will be sent to the rest of the users in the mailing list
data.comment: phrase: Use the slider to define what part of the users in All_Clients mailing list will participate in the A/B test. After the test is finished the winning issue will be sent to the rest of the users in the mailing list

data.name: WinningIssueDescription
data.value: Select the criteria by which the winning issue to be selected. The issue that meets selected criteria will be sent to the rest of the users.
data.comment: phrase: Select the criteria by which the winning issue to be selected. The issue that meets selected criteria will be sent to the rest of the users.

data.name: ABTestEndDescription
data.value: Select when the A/B test should end and the winning issue to be sent to the rest of the users
data.comment: phrase: Select when the A/B test should end and the winning issue to be sent to the rest of the users
